document.title: Health Education Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

F9448600DFE3013191F368A86D17958E.description: Encourage others to be free of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9442980DFE3013191F268A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F943AF00DFE3013191F168A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of effective coping strategies when faced with alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use and abuse by family or friends.

F9436680DFE3013191F068A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9431D50DFE3013191EF68A86D17958E.description: Make a plan to choose healthy alternatives to tobacco and drug use.

F942D350DFE3013191EE68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9428DF0DFE3013191ED68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate strategies to avoid situations where alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs are being used.

F9424220DFE3013191EC68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F941F430DFE3013191EB68A86D17958E.description: Practice effective verbal communication skills to request assistance in situations where alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs are being used.

F941B140DFE3013191EA68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate refusal skills to resist the pressure to experiment with alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F94160E0DFE3013191E968A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9411100DFE3013191E868A86D17958E.description: Identify sources of valid information regarding alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F940BE30DFE3013191E768A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9405C60DFE3013191E668A86D17958E.description: Examine advertising strategies used for alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9400930DFE3013191E568A86D17958E.description: Identify internal and external influences that affect the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F93FC280DFE3013191E468A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F93F7CE0DFE3013191E368A86D17958E.description: Explain why individual reactions to alcohol and drug use may vary.

F93F3670DFE3013191E268A86D17958E.description: Identify family and school rules about alcohol, tobacco, and drug use.

F93EEB10DFE3013191E168A86D17958E.description: Explain the differences between medicines and illicit drugs.

F93E8C80DFE3013191E068A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to cope with situations involving alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F93E2330DFE3013191DF68A86D17958E.description: Describe the harmful short- and long-term effects of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs, including inhalants.

F93DDC90DFE3013191DE68A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F93D51F0DFE3013191DC68A86D17958E.description: Encourage others' safety behaviors (e.g., wearing bicycle helmets and seat belts).

F93D0340DFE3013191DB68A86D17958E.description: Offer friendship and support to someone who was bullied.

F93CB770DFE3013191DA68A86D17958E.description: Encourage specific measures to improve home or school safety.

F93C6000DFE3013191D968A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F93C0F80DFE3013191D868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to execute an escape plan for incidents of fires, floods, earthquakes, and other natural disasters.

F93BBFD0DFE3013191D768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate escape strategies for cases of inappropriate touching or attempted abduction.

F93B66C0DFE3013191D668A86D17958E.description: Follow safety rules and laws at home, at school, and in the community.

F93B2180DFE3013191D568A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate protective gear and equipment.

F93AD710DFE3013191D468A86D17958E.description: Practice disaster preparedness procedures at home and at school.

F93A87A0DFE3013191D368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate strategies to avoid bullying and other types of harassment.

F93A3FF0DFE3013191D268A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F939F980DFE3013191D168A86D17958E.description: Make a personal commitment to stay away from people involved in gang activity.

F939B440DFE3013191D068A86D17958E.description: Make a personal commitment to use appropriate protective gear while engaging in activities.

F93969D0DFE3013191CF68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9390F90DFE3013191CE68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate how following family, school, and community rules can impact safety.

F9389CF0DFE3013191CD68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the benefits of using nonviolent means to resolve conflicts.

F9384490DFE3013191CC68A86D17958E.description: Examine the consequences of bullying and harassment.

F937F750DFE3013191CB68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate strategies to avoid potentially dangerous situations.

F9378900DFE3013191CA68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F9371F80DFE3013191C968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate what to say and do when witnessing bullying.

F936B480DFE3013191C868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate refusal skills to avoid gang involvement.

F9365A60DFE3013191C768A86D17958E.description: Report bullying, harassment, and other dangerous situations.

F9361370DFE3013191C668A86D17958E.description: Practice effective conflict resolution techniques with others.

F935C870DFE3013191C568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use refusal skills in risky situations.

F9357300DFE3013191C468A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9352F60DFE3013191C368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to read and follow labels of common household products concerning dangers and safe use, storage, and proper disposal.

F934E960DFE3013191C268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to dial 9-1-1 or other emergency numbers and how to provide appropriate information.

F9349C60DFE3013191C168A86D17958E.description: Identify trusted adults to report to if people are in danger of hurting themselves or others.

F9344CF0DFE3013191C068A86D17958E.description: Identify safe people and places to go to if feeling unsafe or threatened (e.g., school counselor, police department, fire department).

F933F6C0DFE3013191BF68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to access emergency services and communicate effectively with emergency personnel.

F93389A0DFE3013191BE68A86D17958E.description: Identify accurate sources of information about injury prevention and safety.

F9333C90DFE3013191BD68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F932D590DFE3013191BC68A86D17958E.description: Explain that most young people do not use violence to deal with problems.

F9327A90DFE3013191BB68A86D17958E.description: Examine the influence of violence in media and technology on health behavior.

F9322650DFE3013191BA68A86D17958E.description: Analyze how emotions contribute to both safe and violent behaviors.

F931DD50DFE3013191B968A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F93197E0DFE3013191B868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate escape strategies for cases of inappropriate touching or attempted abduction.

F93150B0DFE3013191B768A86D17958E.description: Explain how courtesy, compassion, and respect toward others reduce conflict and promote nonviolent behavior.

F9310D20DFE3013191B668A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prevent vision and hearing damage.

F930C8A0DFE3013191B568A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to reduce risk of injuries from fires, around water, while riding a motor vehicle, as a pedestrian, on the playground, and from falls.

F93081B0DFE3013191B468A86D17958E.description: Explain what to do if someone is poisoned (e.g., by household cleaning or paint products): call 9-1-1, a poison control center, or other local emergency number.

F9303040DFE3013191B368A86D17958E.description: Identify personal protection equipment needed for sports and recreational activities (e.g., mouthpieces, pads, helmets).

F92FE9A0DFE3013191B268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate proper lifting and carrying techniques for handling heavy backpacks and book bags.

F92F9F80DFE3013191B168A86D17958E.description: Identify positive alternatives to gang activity.

F92F4E50DFE3013191B068A86D17958E.description: Describe the dangers of gang activity

F92EFA90DFE3013191AF68A86D17958E.description: Define a gang and how it is different from a club, sports team, or clique.

F92E9EE0DFE3013191AE68A86D17958E.description: Explain the importance of wearing helmets, pads, mouth guards, water safety vests, and other safety equipment during athletic and outdoor activities.

F92E5040DFE3013191AD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the dangers of having weapons at school, at home, and in the community.

F92E0CC0DFE3013191AC68A86D17958E.description: Describe ways to seek assistance if worried, abused, or threatened.

F92DC4A0DFE3013191AB68A86D17958E.description: Identify disaster preparedness procedures at home, at school, and in the community.

F92D7920DFE3013191AA68A86D17958E.description: Identify basic safety guidelines associated with weather-related emergencies and natural disasters (e.g., floods, earthquakes, and tsunamis).

F92D28A0DFE3013191A968A86D17958E.description: Examine the effects of bullying and harassment on others.

F92CD0D0DFE3013191A868A86D17958E.description: Describe the different types of bullying and harassment.

F92C8B20DFE3013191A768A86D17958E.description: Identify behaviors that may lead to conflict with others.

F92C4840DFE3013191A668A86D17958E.description: Describe safety hazards, including those related to fire, water, dangerous objects, being home alone, and using the Internet.

F92C0310DFE3013191A568A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F92B7BB0DFE3013191A368A86D17958E.description: Support others in making positive food and physical activity choices.

F92B3550DFE3013191A268A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F92ADF80DFE3013191A168A86D17958E.description: Practice how to take personal responsibility for engaging in physical activity.

F92A96A0DFE3013191A068A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to establish and maintain healthy eating practices consistent with current research-based guidelines for a nutritionally balanced diet.

F92A4410DFE30131919F68A86D17958E.description: Practice how to take personal responsibility for limiting sugar consumption in foods, snacks, and beverages.

F929F110DFE30131919E68A86D17958E.description: Practice how to take personal responsibility for eating healthy foods.

F9298E40DFE30131919D68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F92944C0DFE30131919C68A86D17958E.description: Make a plan to choose physical activities at school and at home.

F928F7A0DFE30131919B68A86D17958E.description: Make a plan to choose healthy foods and beverages.

F928B310DFE30131919A68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9286F70DFE30131919968A86D17958E.description: Describe how to use a decision-making process to select healthy options for physical activity.

F92829A0DFE30131919868A86D17958E.description: Describe how to use a decision-making process to select nutritious foods and beverages.

F927DD20DFE30131919768A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F92774C0DFE30131919668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate effective communication skills to ask for healthy food choices.

F9271380DFE30131919568A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F926D260DFE30131919468A86D17958E.description: Use food labels to determine nutrient and sugar content.

F9269100DFE30131919368A86D17958E.description: Identify resources for valid information about safe and healthy foods.

F9264C90DFE30131919268A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9260B00DFE30131919168A86D17958E.description: Identify internal and external influences that affect physical activity

F925C6F0DFE30131919068A86D17958E.description: Analyze advertising and marketing techniques used for food and beverages.

F9257E40DFE30131918F68A86D17958E.description: Identify internal and external influences that affect food choices.

F9252DF0DFE30131918E68A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F924E640DFE30131918D68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to increase and monitor physical activity.

F9249FE0DFE30131918C68A86D17958E.description: Describe the benefits of moderate and vigorous physical activity.

F9245C30DFE30131918B68A86D17958E.description: Explain the importance of drinking plenty of water, especially during vigorous physical activity.

F9241600DFE30131918A68A86D17958E.description: Explain how food can contain germs that cause illness.

F923CB00DFE30131918968A86D17958E.description: Identify how to keep food safe through proper food preparation and storage.

F9237310DFE30131918868A86D17958E.description: Describe the relationship between food intake, physical activity, and good health.

F9232480DFE30131918768A86D17958E.description: State the recommended number of servings and serving sizes for different food groups.

F922D6E0DFE30131918668A86D17958E.description: Identify and define key nutrients and their functions.

F92282E0DFE30131918568A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.
